Processed meat is not healthy. Eating too much meat is not healthy either. Vegetarian options should be the norm and meat should be eaten rarely (if at all). That is a balanced diet.

Non-organic meat is not healthy. It contains a lot of antibiotics and is low in nutritional value because the animals were not fed a diverse diet. You can replace processed meat with organic meat and/or vegetables and grains for a more healthy and balanced diet
That is not necessarily true, especially for processed meat. Replacing it with vegetables, nuts and grains would contribute just as much (if not more) to a balanced diet
Eating vegetables and decreasing carbohydrates has been proven more effective at a balanced diet than eating meat.
red meat is not healthy and there are many other choices outside of meat that are healthy and balanced
not all meat is healthy and only contributes to a balanced diet if it is not processed too much.

Only if eaten in moderation.
Generally meat is not healthy due to high levels of processing

Eating meat every day is not healthy (even if its high quality/organic meat). Our ancestors also did not eat meat in such quantities as we consume today. They ate much more berries, mushrooms and starchy vegetables than we eat today.

Meat does more harm than good if you buy it processed and non-organic. Cutting processed, un-organic meat out of your diet will be more healthy than eating it. Replacing it with a variety it vegetables and grains will make your diet more balanced

Processed meat is not healthy and consuming meat on a daily basis (or even several times a day) isn't either. Reducing your meat consumption and substituting it with fresh vegetables and grains will contribute to a much more balanced diet.
A diet can be very healthy and balanced with or without meat
Pulses, such as lentils, grains, fruits, vegetables, and vegetarian options such as tofu are also healthy, and contribute equally well to a balanced diet.
